plot: Autobots Bumblebee, Ratchet, Ironhide, Mirage (aka Dino), Wheeljack (aka Que) and Sideswipe led by Optimus Prime, are back in action taking on the evil Decepticons, who are eager to avenge their recent defeat. The Autobots and Decepticons become involved in a perilous space race between the United States and Russia, to reach a hidden Cybertronian spacecraft on the moon and learn its secrets, and once again Sam Witwicky has to come to the aid of his robot friends. The new villain Shockwave is on the scene while the Autobots and Decepticons continue to battle it out on Earth.

m.role: Badass Grandpa: Sentinel Prime. Even after being in a coma for over one thousand years, he's still perfectly capable of taking on the whole Autobot team, without breaking a sweat.
In Transformers: Dark of the Moon, Simmons gets one with Dutch, who while usually somewhat neurotic and effeminate proves to be quite dangerous if pushed.
Sentinel Prime from Transformers: Dark of the Moon.
Transformers: Dark of the Moon: Dylan.  He betrayed Earth to the Decepticons just so he would be safe.

f.role: Carly saves the day by using her intelligence to talk Megatron into attacking Sentinel, after spending most of the climax as a Damsel in Distress. No one noticed.

Fanservice Extra: A Latino lady at Sam's office, who's wearing something revealing just because. Like in the last movie, every female character except Sam's mother and Mearing is gorgeous and wearing skirts and dresses two sizes too small for them.
Ms. Fanservice: Carly. The movie sets out its stall early in this regard - her very first appearance is a tracking shot of her bikini-clad ass.
Never a Self-Made Woman: Carly's position with Dylan's company. Though she was formerly a part of the British Diplomacy, but that originates from the highly military filled family.

name: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
